title: Technical Program Manager, Data Center Manufacturing Systems
description: A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all.
key_qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of experience in technical program management within a manufacturing supply chain environment.
preferred_qualifications: 2 years of experience managing cross-functional or cross-team projects. Experience managing project delivery. Ability to motivate and lead multi-disciplinary teams, build consensus, and drive accountability. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
responsibilities: Lead a cross-functional team driving design, development, and deployment of data center systems globally. Manage product life-cycle software tools for data centers. Manage product documentation (e.g., Business Requirements, Pilot Plan, etc.), phase gate reviews, communication and user feedback collection at various stages in the life-cycle (e.g., User Acceptance Testing, User Surveys, Critical User Journeys). Lead collaboration for Engineering, Product Management, Operations, Supply Chain, and Fleet Deployment teams to ensure regional and global alignment on strategic product and technology roadmaps. Help deliver data center up-time, operational performance variation reduction, defect reduction, and cost reduction.
